ranked_diseases.explanation: Exact match with Case 1 reference showing all three features (short stature, short metacarpal, intellectual disability). PHP1A is characterized by Albright hereditary osteodystrophy features including these symptoms.
Strong match with Case 2 reference, sharing all three core features. PPHP presents with Albright hereditary osteodystrophy phenotype without hormone resistance.
PHP1C presents with similar features to PHP1A including short stature, brachydactyly, and intellectual disability, but with different molecular etiology.
Presents with short stature, brachydactyly (short metacarpals), and intellectual disability. Often confused with pseudohypoparathyroidism due to overlapping features.
Similar to Acrodysostosis 1 with short stature, short metacarpals, and variable intellectual disability, caused by PDE4D mutations.
The phenotypic spectrum that includes short stature, brachydactyly, and intellectual disability, encompassing both PHP and PPHP.
Characterized by brachydactyly (including short metacarpals), intellectual disability, and short stature as key features.
Presents with brachydactyly type E (short metacarpals), intellectual disability, and short stature, phenotypically similar to AHO.
